Job Title: Jr - Mid Level Enterprise Technical Presales Solutions Engineer

Job Description:
To apply please visit www.onewirtzrecruiting.com




Required Duties:
Plumbing: includes the repair, removal, replacement, or installation of faucets, pipes, hot water tanks, toilets, garbage disposals, dishwashers, water-dispensing refrigerators, and washing machines.
Electrical: includes the repair, replacement or installation of power switches, fuses, wall sockets, ceiling lights, ceiling fans, climate control systems, and garage doors openers.
Drywall repair: includes filling in small holes caused by nails and minor dings from normal wear and tear, most commonly performed between the time a tenant vacates a unit and a new renter assumes occupancy.
Painting: includes minor touch-ups following damage repair and new coats of paint applied to unit walls between the time a tenant vacates a unit and a new renter assumes occupancy, as well as, in the common areas.
Appliance repair: includes the repair, replacement or installation of major household appliances, such as refrigerators, dishwashers, range ovens, washers and dryers, hot water tanks, and air conditioners.
Grounds keeping: includes mowing grass, pulling weeds, trimming and pruning trees and shrubs, watering lawns and plants, replacing light bulbs along pathways and parking areas, sweeping or raking leaves, and tidying up bark or other ground covering.
Cleaning/housekeeping: includes maintaining a tidy appearance in shared community locations, such as the leasing office lobby, clubhouses, fitness or recreational areas, common hallways, also can include deep cleaning of vacant units on the turn, including the bathroom, kitchen, appliances, and fixtures.
Snow removal: includes shoveling, snow blowing or snow plowing from walkways, stairs and driveways, as well as, spreading ice melt to all surfaces to prevent.
Customer service: includes professional, prompt and courteous correspondence with residents on a regular basis. Including, when scheduling and providing maintenance services, delivering or distributing packages; and in any type of interaction. As well as, with contracted vendors that provide additional services.
Time management: includes maintaining an organized scheduling and tracking system, usually on a computer, to effectively complete all maintenance requests in a timely manner and in the order by which they were received or by level of urgency.
Organization: Assists in the maintenance and organization of the maintenance office, storage shops, utility rooms and closets. As well as recording details about work completed in units in the property software and log books.
Additional Duties:
Performing routine inspection walks/rounds of buildings and grounds at regular intervals when on shift; verifying doors, windows, and locks are securely fastened.
Assist in maintaining service elevator schedule for resident moves.
Observes appearances and conditions of premises and equipment; reports needed repairs, safety hazards, or conditions requiring outside vendor services.
Be a good steward of the community with the best interests of customer service and maintenance in mind.
Must Possess:
Strong interpersonal and communication skills: verbal, listening and written
Strong organizational skills, both electronically and paper
Exhibit initiative and be proactive when necessary
Display discreetness, awareness and confidentiality of work
Team player, ability to take direction and work on a team
Ability to complete work assignments in a timely manner, utilize appropriate chemicals and supplies, maintain set quality standards when performing job duties, observes safety precautions at all times, applies a common sense understanding to carry out detailed, but occasionally written or oral instructions.
Required Skills:
A minimum two years' experience in residential building maintenance
Working knowledge of MS Office and computer skills (YARDI)
Ability to work a computer for basic tasks such as operating camera system, controlled access software and property maintenance software
Have working knowledge of IPhone
Physical Demands of Job:
Walks, stands, stoops, bends most of day.
May lift in excess of 50 pounds
May carry in excess of 50 pounds.
Other physical demands include, reaching above, at and below shoulder height, pushing/pulling, grasping, handling, twisting, bending, crawling, squatting, kneeling, crouching and climbing.

MapUp is seeking a transportation planning engineer for the firm’s Sunnyvale office. The engineer will lead the design, development and maintenance of MapUp mapping data pipelines, algorithms, and geographic information systems (GIS) based mapping intelligence decision engine.

What you will do
Work with a variety of spatial datasets, including road networks, land use, points of interest, system data, elevation/terrain, and multi-source imagery to augment online maps
Use deep geographic knowledge, including familiarity with cartographic conventions and expectations to develop customer focused mapping solutions
Develop and maintain models to forecast future travel demand, evaluate transportation system performance, and provide technical expertise in analyzing travel demand alternatives.
Use proficiency with programming language to create programs to automate tasks, Intermediate Python proficiency with experience utilizing relevant libraries for data analysis, process automation, and spatial analysis
Work on imagery processing and analysis and with Neural Networks and ML applications. Responsible for technical accuracy of the products
Use cell phone and GPS data from big data analytics to derive travel patterns for study areas. Use the travel patterns to verify/modify speeds from a 4-step travel demand model. Incorporate the use of big data technologies in mobility analytics. Lead efforts for travel pattern data visualization and location-based analytics.
Analyze, assess, and supervise travel demand model results and prepare tables/graphics/plots of results for presentations and reports. Analyze information and evaluate results to choose the best solution and solve problems. Identify information by categorizing, estimating, recognizing differences or similarities, and detecting changes in circumstances or events.
Work with mapping services such as Google maps, HERE maps, OSM, TomTom, etc.
Use big datasets from relational and NoSQL databases to store and retrieve spatial information for mapping algorithms. Use statistical techniques and algorithms to develop optimal routes based on multiple vectors. Work closely with other data scientists and app developers leading the development of mapping platform
Gather requirements around functionality and translate those requirements into elegant functional solutions. Build prototypes at tech scoping stage of projects. Working with the front-end developers to build the interface with focus on usability features.
Optimizing server performance for different combinations of cloud offerings.
Explain technologies and solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Identify business opportunities. Prepare budgets, bids, and contracts. Review and recommend contracts. Responsible for technical accuracy.
Communicating with people outside MapUp, representing MapUp to customers, the public, government, and other external sources.
Work with the CEO and CTO to develop vision, operational strategy and execute a strategic plan. Build partnership with the tolling agencies, governmental agencies to create toll payment solutions
Oversee the research and development of new products, specifications and procedures. Be a part of the strategic planning, marketing, and business operations planning
Collaborate with engineers to research, analyze, or resolve complex transportation design issues.
Hire, train, and mentor engineers and supporting staff. Write performance reviews and solve internal issues.
Establish administrative policies, procedures, and standards.
Attend industry events/conference – both attending and presenting.
Qualifications and Experience

· Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Civil/Transportation Engineering, Regional Planning, Transportation Planning, Urban Planning or related degree. Master’s degree in Civil Engineering or Planning with emphasis in Transportation preferred.

· Proven record working on mapping and tolling projects. Knowledge of techniques used in the collection, organization and analysis of sociological, economic and other related data. Knowledge of federal and state laws related to transportation planning.

· Knowledge of use and operation of transportation systems, developing transportation models or simulations.

· Working knowledge of GIS software such as ArcGIS, QGIS and transportation planning software such as TransCAD, Cube, etc., OpenStreetMap editing tools such as JOSM, HERE maps creator, My Maps, etc.

· Knowledge of use cell phone and GPS data from big data analytics to derive travel patterns, travel pattern data visualization, location-based analytics and route optimization.

· Excellent knowledge in information architecture, NoSQL databases, Cloud platforms (AWS).

· Working knowledge of databases and structured query language (SQL)

· A track record of delivering successful consumer and or business products.

· Ability to use analytical data, customer feedback and field-testing and inform design decision.

· A passion for new consumer technology and the emerging media landscape.

· Ability to multitask and good time management skills.

· Ability to work on their own and as a part of the team.

· Excellent scoping and estimation skills.

· Understanding of languages like Python, JavaScript.

· Experience on web service integration (REST, JSON, XML).

· Using version control (e.g. Git).

· Seven years of experience in a transportation planning related field. Any equivalent combination of training and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities may also be considered.

· Professional Engineer (PE) and PMP preferred

Major Responsibilities: Forge relationships with internal and external clients to develop the business understanding to design and deliver integrated solutions driving incremental and long term value. Act as principal design and development leader who guides the development team to construct world-class new and advanced middleware solutions and re-evaluate and refine existing solutions. Represent the organization on project teams and may lead technical project and write high level design specifications. Design, code and debug existing complex laboratory workflow applications in various software languages. Gather information, analyze and execute user requirements based on customer requests. Develop coding languages consistent with product needs and quality standards.

Utilizing statistical analysis tools such as MATLAB or WEKA; 7.) Performing controlled testing of software (i.e. documented environment protocol steps) and 8.) Performing simultaneous development of multiple software applications.

JOB SUMMARY:
The Senior Software Performance Engineer is responsible for developing, executing, debugging and maintaining performance test scripts in support of the business meeting performance SLA's.
Lead and facilitate software performance requirements gathering meetings and estimate efforts based on empirical experience and proven methods
Analyze architectural, navigational, and hardware design documents/diagrams for load/performance testing design execution
Build complex simulators to simulate virtual users that match a real life scenario to identify and help tune the enterprise applications for better performance
Gain complete understanding of both infrastructure and enterprise technical architecture of systems under test with the ability to identify typical performance issues and bottlenecks.
Identify, communicate and track performance issues to closure working in close collaboration with cross-functional development team including analysts and developers.
Write and review performance test reports covering the results of testing activities and communicate test results and metrics to other IT system groups, business units and management
Establish and champion Performance QA standards, procedures, and processes by staying abreast of the latest industry trends; develop road maps for Performance Testing Services.
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Proven interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, including technical documentation skills
Advanced knowledge of database concepts including advanced SQL programming skills
Advanced knowledge of SDLC & varying software development methodologies
Expert in profiling, identifying & resolving performance issues at application & DB level
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts and ideas in simple, understandable business language
Ability to learn new tools and programming languages with little formal training
Ability to analyze complex statistics to generate system performance math models
Expert ability to use performance monitoring & analysis tools on client, middleware & backend app component.
REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s Degree in related field of study OR 4 years relevant experience, OR a combination of college education and relevant experience equivalent to 4 years.

AND

After the move, your role will shift to maintenance and further development of new features.

Job Description

CDK Global is actively seeking an experienced Operations Lead to streamline operations for the product and technology group across multiple products servicing our internal and external business partners and clients.

As the Operations Engineer within the CDK Global Product and Technology team you will be a hands-on engineer defining and implementing best practices and standards for operational excellence across multiple products, platforms and teams

Key Responsibilities and Deliverables
Work with Product & Technology, Infrastructure, Enterprise Architecture, Product Development and Security teams to help formulate and implement operational best practices, governing policies and processes for supporting existing and new applications/products
Operationalize new technologies quickly, including topics like cloud storage, software defined infrastructure, application container technologies and microservices architecture. Socialize the DevOps culture.
Help design and implement an asset master and asset (product) classification for improved visibility, prioritization and aligning availability and support requirements based on product criticality
Help define and implement a configuration management tool that enables linking of infrastructure and application configuration items for better tracking, impact analysis etc
Define and implement service management processes that are consistent and aligned with our DevSecOps strategy
Integrate existing tools/processes to improve visibility and consolidation of support tasks and service management functions
Implement processes and support SOX/Regulatory Compliance and Security Scans for our products from an operational standpoint to ensure we stay compliant for internal and external audits
Design and implement dashboards to track and monitor key operational metrics including availability, incidents, defects, problems etc.
Conduct action oriented periodic operational reviews, health checks, capacity assessments and performance evaluations
Socialize and communicate operational services and best practices with all stakeholders and partners
Participate in providing Coverage for Operations Support
Drive continuous improvement for Operations – Automate and autocorrect how we address issues systematically
Provide technical insights to team and present/influence technology direction in business context to our partners.
Identifying functional & non-functional requirements that are not currently met by the required capabilities and advocate solutions to address these gaps. Applying appropriate approaches to assessing trade-offs among architectural goals
Address customer escalations to completion and pursue root cause analysis and solutions
Provide thought leadership in growth and strategic initiatives
Work independently with limited supervision, share learning with peers
Qualifications and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar discipline, Masters a plus
1-3 years’ experience in Operations and Managing Operations across multiple platforms and applications. DevOps exposure a plus.
Ability to providing support coverage
Ability to share technical skills with peers as well as partners we collaborate with
Ability to implement Operational Best practices,
Ability to use tools to implement Operational Dashboards
Passion for continuous improvement of operations – automate where it makes sense
Familiarity with Service Management Areas like Escalation Management, Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management and exposure to Service Management Tools (like Service Manager, Service Now) and Configuration Management
Good understanding of technology underlying databases as well as infrastructure
Familiarity with Application Lifecycle Management
Ability to understand and implement SOX/Regulatory Compliance and Security Scans. DAST and SAST integration in an automated pipeline is a plus.
Ability to understand and Implement Capacity, Performance, Monitoring and Alerting Functions
Good presentation, documentation and communication skills
Technical craving and eagerness to learn. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
Experience working in a team-oriented collaborative environment
CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. Supervisory Responsibilities:

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience:
High School Diploma or GED;
Five years’ minimum experience in development, installation, and troubleshooting of PLC, HMI and motor control systems.
Language Skills:

Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.

Mathematical Skills:

Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.

Reasoning Ability:

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

Computer Skills:
K nowledge of and experience working with Microsoft Office, MS-DOS, Windows 95, Windows NT, Windows 2000, Windows XP in multi-domain environment.
Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:

Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Specialized training in PLC control and machine control.
Documentation (Instruction, rung, section).
HMI knowledge: object type, screen layouts, animation, alarms, scripting.
Knowledge of NEC codes, NFPA codes, IEC codes, etc.
Proficient in Schneider Electric Modicon series of PLCs and I/O interfaces, and the Unity software package (including Vijeo Designer).
Proficient in Rockwell/Allen Bradley ControlLogix series of PLCs and I/O interfaces, and the FactoryTalk Studio 5000 software package (including RSLogiz and FactoryTalk View).
Proficient in Wonderware Suit of software solutions.
Proficient in AutoCAD Electrical/Product Design Suite Software package.
Ladder logic and Statement List.
Function Block Diagram.
File Structure, program organization.
Functional requirements specification.
Diagnostic and analytical skills.
Ability to read and understand drawings for electrical controls and mechanical parts.
Work flexible hours to meet project/task deadlines.
Other Qualifications:
Must be able to accommodate hours outside of regular shift when necessary.
Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts and risk of electrical shock. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

We are looking for a talented Level I or Level II Microsoft Systems Engineers, who have experience working in SMB environments as part of an MSP. We use ConnectWise as our PSA tool and strongly prefer someone with experience there.

We are going through significant growth and our environment is fast-paced, so we're looking for engineers who enjoy days that move quickly and tasks that will hone your skills. The only thing holding back our growth is the number of person-hours we have available.
We are looking for engineers who love a good challenge and problem solving, and working in a close team environment. Depending on the day’s tasks, you might work in our office in Greensboro, NC or at a client site. Occasional travel may be required.

-Competitive salary and generous bonus structure
-Full benefits package, including free health & vision, disability, and life insurance for employees.
-Training programs to improve your skills and prepare you for advancement
-Paid vacations and holidays, including your birthday
-A family-friendly environment
-Challenging projects in a fast-paced environment
-Collaborative process
-Growth opportunities

Level I Desired Skills and Experience
-3+ years of experience as a Help Desk Technician in an MSP environment
-Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
We’d also prefer someone familiar with:
-ConnectWise
-Legal, human and veterinary health, and/or financial practice management software
-Active Directory, Exchange, VMWare

Level II Desired Skills and Experience
-3+ years of experience as a Systems Engineer 1+ in an MSP environment
-Experience with Active Directory, Exchange, VMWare
-Powershell scripting experience
-Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
We’d also prefer someone familiar with:
-ConnectWise
-Legal, human and veterinary health, and/or financial practice management software
-Microsoft Deployment Toolkit

About Longleaf
Longleaf System & Network Specialists is a small Managed Service Provider that specializes in professional services clients (legal, health, financial services, and veterinary practices). We've been growing steadily since opening our doors in 2006 and serve 200+ locations nationally. We have an office in Greensboro, NC, and an office in Connecticut.
Our Corporate Values are:
-Honesty
-Responsibility
-Transparency
-Stewardship
-Expertise
-Quality and Accuracy

Competitors: Citi, Bank of America, Wells Fargo
Job Description:
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field or equivalent experience
Preferred Qualifications
3 years of experience in programming in Angular, Cocoa, Objective C, C#, HTML, .NET, PHP, Java, Progress or other programming languages
3 years of experience in software testing and design
3 years of experience in database management as it relates to software development
Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite
Job Summary

The Senior Software Engineer uses various programming languages to develop, improve, test and/or maintain software that meets user needs. They mentor other software engineers, lead small development teams and act as an application owner. The Senior Software Engineer takes a lead role in design and code reviews, assists with delivery estimates and provides feedback about all aspects of the process.

Responsibilities
Design, develop or modify software and/or software systems by using various programming languages depending on the product and also taking the service architecture into consideration
Modify existing software to fix errors, improve the overall quality and functionality, or update integrations with other software
Analyze user needs to determine how software should be built or if existing software should be modified
Develop and/or perform software automated testing procedures, solutions and frameworks to ensure software functions as needed
Translate business requirements and specifications into usable and scalable software
Process and understand capabilities and limitations of data outputs from the software
Understand and assist with the technical infrastructure of an application or system
Troubleshoot performance issues
Lead design and code reviews
Lead delivery estimates
Determine and execute the software deployment process
Anticipate and communicate blockers, delays and cost ballooning within the teams projects before they require escalation
Ensure expectations with the team and external stakeholders are clarified between all parties involved
Mentor other software engineers
Look for security vulnerabilities in coding
Participate in discussions about the teams future vision and strategy
Who We Are

We're America's largest mortgage lender, closing loans in all 50 states. J.D. Power ranked Quicken Loans "Highest in Customer Satisfaction in Primary Mortgage Origination" for the past 10 consecutive years, 2010 - 2019. The company was also ranked highest in the nation for client satisfaction among mortgage servicers by J.D. Power for 6 consecutive years, 2014 through 2019, each year the company was eligible. There's a simple reason we've been so successful: We care about the people we work with.

If you're tired of stuffy, bureaucratic workplaces, then you'll be delighted to find something different here. We strive to make a creative, fun and collaborative environment you simply won't find anywhere else. Quicken Loans was named #1 in ESSENCE Magazine's first ever list of "Best Places to Work for African Americans" in 2015. We've been on Computerworld's "Best Places to Work in IT" list for 13 years running, hitting #1 the last 5 years. We were also ranked #14 in FORTUNE Magazine's list of "100 Best Companies to Work For" in 2018, remaining in the top 30 for the past 15 years.
